ygData.messageBody:
On Wed, 2 Jun 1999, Talies the Wanderer wrote:
> >>
> >> A question about the lullaby spell. Is its area of effect centered
> >> on you as the caster, or can you target something some distance from
> >> you and it is centered on your target?
> >
> >Centered on you. Goatnatos' guide says it also clears the
> >hate list. Has anyone found this to be the case? They always
> >seem to attack me when they wake up, no matter how far I run
> >away. I tried testing it on mobs other people were attacking
> >but the results were inconclusive.
>
> OOooh nononononono - It INCREASES the Hate list, as near as I can tell.
> Bards are public enemy #1 when singing this song.

Yes I know that. What I was wondering was if someone has
fought a mob past half dead (at which point it would normally
be almost impossible to pull the mob off him), can you fire up
the song and mob will now attack the bard or the next person
to attack him? That's what I was trying to figure out.

Nevertheless, even if this effect exists, hatred for the bard
seems to be excepted (stuff you put to sleep for a long time
will attack you until they die even though someone else is
killing it), which kinda makes it useless except for a
twinking exploit.
